result.execSummary:
The defendant Otis M Frazier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, surcharges. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.  Credit for 132 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: **10/5/2015  Concurrent with count one.   Credit for 132 days.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Otis M Frazier
Current: 5560 N. 39TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53209-4614 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2016)
Prior: 4142 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing 08/27/2015 received and filed.  CH
Count two per Order signed on 10/5/2015:  JOC shall be amended to state that count two is concurrent with count one.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request for sentence clarification.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Otis M Frazier in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6.5 YEARS with 132 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3.5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 132 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Bail Refund Packets
Parties stipulate to reduction of bail to $500.00 cash. All other conditions remain.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court ordered the MPD letter to be sealed. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/27/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Otis M Frazier in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Otis M Frazier in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an Information amending the amount in Count 1 to 5-15 grams), pursuant to Wis Stat 961.41(1m)(cm)2, a class "E" Felony.
